main event: On April 2, 1952, while on a fishing trip at Lake Mead, Nevada, three individuals observed a silver-colored unidentified object that hovered in the sky.
interesting points: The object was described to be very large, resembling a B-36 bomber without wings., Witnesses estimated it was at a tremendous altitude, higher than vapor trails from conventional aircraft., The sighting lasted for approximately one hour before the object vanished., The observation was visually confirmed by M/Sgt Charles Blue, his wife, and a friend., The attention of the witnesses was initially drawn by a flight of aircraft passing overhead.
sighted object: a large, silver, wingless object hovering in the sky
witness description: M/Sgt Charles Blue, his wife, and a friend, with M/Sgt having 12 years of service in the Air Force.
